titleInfo.title: The asparagine synthetase gene VfAS1 is strongly expressed in the nitrogen-fixing zone of broad bean (Vicia faba L) root nodules

mods.abstract: A full-length transcript sequence encoding the broad bean (Vicia faba L.) asparagine synthetase (AS) VfAS1 was isolated from a nodule cDNA library. Sequence homologies indicated that VfAS1 belonged to the glutamine-dependent type of AS enzymes. The corresponding gene was highly expressed in root nodules and at a three-fold lower level in uninfected roots. Additionally, traces of VfAS1 transcripts were detected in epicotyl and stem tissues. Tissue-print hybridizations revealed that the VfAS1 gene was strongly expressed in the nitrogen-fixing zone III of root nodules. VfAS1 transcripts were absent from the meristem, the prefixing zone IE as well as from peripheral nodule tissues. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science Ireland Ltd.
